cards.name: Switch
text: Switch 1 of your Benched Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 damage for each Energy attached to Poliwag but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Energy after the end don't count.

attacks.name: Sand-attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Spearow was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Spearow to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Impostor Professor Oak
text: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 7 cards.

cards.name: Item Finder
text: Discard 2 other cards from your hand in order to put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Professor Oak
text: Discard your hand, then draw 7 cards.

cards.name: Double Colorless Energy
text: Provides energy. Doesn't count as a basic energy card.

cards.name: Potion
text: Remove up to 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Clefable's type is still Colorless.)

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Clefable during your opponent's next turn is reduce by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding energy cards. (No matter what type the defender is, Clefairy's type is still Colorless.)

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Barrier
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Mewtwo in order to use this attack. During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mewtwo.

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Ninetales in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Poliwrath but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 and discard it.

ability.name: Buzzap
ability.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack) you may Knock Out Electrode and attach it to 1 of your other Pokémon. If you do, chose a type of Energy. is now an Energy card (instead of a Pokémon) that provides 2 energy of that type. This power can't be used if Electrode is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Electric Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrode does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Fetch
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

ability.name: Invisible Wall
ability.text: Whenever an attack (including your own) does 30 or more damage to Mr. Mime (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power can't be used if Mr. Mime is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Charmeleon in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Fearow.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 50 damage minus 10 for each damage counter on Machoke.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of defenders attacks. Defender cannot use that attack next turn.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times number of heads.

attacks.name: Ram
attacks.text: Rhydon does 20 damage to itself. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon. Switch the Pokémon even if Rhydon is knocked out.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Charmander in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Snivel
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Cubone during your opponent's next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Cubone.

attacks.name: Sleeping Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Destiny Bond
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Gastly in order to use this attack. If a Pokémon Knocks Out Gastly during your opponent's next turn, Knock Out that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magnemite does 40 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Metapod during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Nidoran M or Nidoran F and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Onix (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Rhyhorn during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Venonat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Pokédex
text: Look at up to 5 cards from the top of your deck and rearrange them as you like.

cards.name: Super Potion
text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokémon in order to remove up to 4 damage counters from that Pokémon.

cards.name: Bill
text: Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Energy Removal
text: Choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

cards.name: Gust of Wind
text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

cards.name: PlusPower
text: Attach PlusPower to your Active Pokémonn. At the end of your turn, discard PlusPower. If this Pokémon's attack does damage to the defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Super Energy Removal
text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokémon in order to choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and up to 2 Energy cards attached to it. Discard those energy cards.

cards.name: Defender
text: Attach Defender to 1 of your Pokémon. At the end of your opponent's next turn, discard Defender. Damage done to that Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance.)

cards.name: Full Heal
text: Your Active Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.

cards.name: Maintenance
text: Shuffle 2 of the other cards from your hand into your deck in order to draw a card.

cards.name: Poké Ball
text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for any Basic Pokémon or Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Pokemon Center
text: Remove all damage counters from all of your own Pokémon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times number of damage counters on Magikarp.

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Lass
text: You and your opponent show each other your hands, then shuffle all the trainer cards from your hands into your decks.

cards.name: Pokemon Breeder
text: Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokémon. You can only play this card when you would be allowed to evolve that Pokémon anyway.

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, return the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Pokemon Trader
text: Trade 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards in your hand for 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from your deck. Show both cards to your opponent. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 times number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 times number of heads.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

ability.name: Retreat Aid
ability.text: As long as Dodrio is Benched, pay 1 Colorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Irongrip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Kadabra in order use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

cards.name: Scoop Up
text: Choose 1 of your own Pokémon in play and return its Basic Pokémon card to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fighting Basic Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Bulbasaur.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Boyfriends
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Nidoking you have in play.

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Chansey during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Chansey does 80 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 80 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10).

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch Exeggutor with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: You can't this attack unless the Defending Pokémon is Asleep.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tongue Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
